job_title: Computer Lab Technician in Bennington, VT
pros: Best location to work in New England.
cons: Pay is very low at Bennington. Many positions are 8 month contracts.

review_title: Great institution, wish morale were higher
pros: Such a fantastic educational mission - it was easy to believe in the mission of the college.
cons: Poor morale on campus during times of transition. It seemed like folks were trying to address it, not sure if they have.

pros: This institution has its allegiances and that is all I can share.
cons: See statement above. It is all.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Very helpful staff, has helped me with work
cons: Can get stressfull juggling too many tasks at once

pros: Loved my time here solely because of the people; truly a family, and I loved being able to advocate for progressive education every day. Lots of flexibility w/r/t remote work during the pandemic and opportunities to move up within the office.
cons: High turnover. My salary was nowhere near a living wage – especially with the amount of travel and unpaid overtime necessary during peak application season – and benefits weren't fantastic, either.

Siloed enclave, rural, alienating, and disconnected from the town. If you appreciate diversity within a work environment coupled with it being mirrored in the town in which the college is situated, living in rural VT may not be for you.

pros: The flexibility and coworkers are great
cons: The salary is not so great

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Bennington, VT
pros: people are great and amazing and cool
cons: location is rural, cold, and isolated

pros: Great people to work with and very flexible.
cons: Too much work for a student

review_title: It was a really great job to do for people who like helping others
pros: we were able to have our own rooms and got paid.
cons: we did a lot of work for the pay but I wouldn't say it's always hard work or not worth it.
rural location can lead to isolation

pros:
4 weeks vacation and time off
Great holiday schedule
The place is actually a really interesting institution 
truly beautiful campus and buildings
Interesting and compelling student work all over
The offices are beautiful 
Good conversations and thoughtful people 
The food on campus is great
Alums are fantastic 
HR does a really nice job hosting a great holiday party and staff appreciation day
cons:
Morale can be very low
Many staff are overworked and under recognized 
Faculty/staff divide is real 
health benefits are really expensive 
There is a lot of turn over and that makes doing anything long term difficult
Leadership is wishy washy, they’re big on the talk but not on the walk
Financial uncertainty makes planning very hard
No professional development or time for development 
Tuition exchange is a lottery and only one kid is eligible for the tuition exchange 
It is almost impossible to take classes as a staffer, and basically impossible if you want credit. no one does it.

pros: The benefits are great and the opportunity for growth is pretty much readily available, though this ultimately depends on your department and your skills. Generally, the college affords staff to pursue what they are interested in, which is wonderful. Great people to work with.
cons: One of the only cons to working here is that the salaries are on the lower end of the pay scale, given location and size of institution. There is also a large discrepancy between upper management salaries and the rest of the staff. The work is challenging and expectations are high, and employees should be more rewarded for their commitments.

job_title: Assistant to the President in Bennington, VT
pros: Administrative hours are good and the campus is beautiful
cons:
Dysfunctional administration  
Lack of Training and support
Low Wages
Expensive health insurance
Long interview process (months)

job_title: Post Office Supervisor in Bennington, VT
pros: Bennington is a very good place to work - the people are great, and the college is an organization that you can really get behind. Good benefits also. There is an energy to working around college students, as they all have a thirst for learning that is infectious.
cons: The organization has some problems with inter-department coordination, which can make it difficult to get some kinds of tasks done. It takes time to build personal relationships that let you get around the red tape and achieve your goals.

pros: Pretty campus, coworkers were just as stressed
cons: Management pays themselves well. Little people work their butts off.

pros: Amazing people, engaged and welcoming working environment, mission-driven work
